intro: Eriocaulon iringense, commonly known as the Iriŋe swamp grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in wetland or swampy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in spikelets, a common feature among grasses. Eriocaulon iringense plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and may have traditional uses in local communities.
